description.en: During the course a student will learn the main methods that are used in the modelling of physical processes. THe mothods will cover processes from micro to macro scale. The topics that will be presented are: density functional theory for quantum mechanical modelling of a material, monte carlo and molecular dynamics for empirical atomistic simulations, finite element method for studying processes in the continuum and mathematical methods for solving differential equations. Additionally, all topics are accompanied with practical exercises that help to understand the topics even further.
description.et: Kursese käigus tutvustatakse tudengile põhilisi meetodeid füüsiklaiste protsesside modelleerimiseks. Meetodid katavad valdkondi mikroskaalast kuni makrotasandini välja. Käsitletavateks teemadeks on: "density functional theory" materjalide kvantmehaaniliseks modelleerimiseks, "monte carlo" ja "molecular dynamics" empiirilisteks atomistlikeks simulatsioonideks, "finite element method" pidevate suuruste uurimiseks ning matemaatilised meetodid diferentsiaalvõrrandite lahendamiseks. Lisaks lahendatakse iga valdkonna juures praktilisi ülesandeid teema kinnistamiseks.

objectives.en: The purpose of the course is to give an overview and practical experience of methods that are mainly used in the modelling of physical processes.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärgiks on anda ülevaade koos praktiliste ülesannete põhilistest meetoditest, mida kasutatakse füüsikaliste protsesside kompuutermodelleerimisel.

learning_outcomes.en: Student who has passed the course:
* Knows about the principles of multiscale modelling.
* Knows the applicability of density functional theory and is able to use it for solving problems.
learning_outcomes.et: * Teab "density functional method" arvutuste rakendusvaldkonda ning oskab kasutada seda lihtsamatele probleemide lahendamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: * Knows the applicability of monte carlo and is able to use it for solving problems.
learning_outcomes.et: * Teab "monte carlo" rakendusvaldkonda ning oskab luua programmi, mis viiks läbi lihtsamat MC simulatsiooni.

learning_outcomes.en: * Knows the applicability of molecular dynamics and is able to use it for solving problems.
learning_outcomes.et: * Teab "molecular dynamics" rakendusvaldkonda ning oskab kasutada seda probleemide lahendamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: * Knows the applicability of finite element method and is able to use it for solving problems.
learning_outcomes.et: * Teab "finite element method" rakendusvaldkonda ning oskab kastuada seda probleemide lahendamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: * Know about mathematical methods for solving differential equations an is able to use them for solving problems.
learning_outcomes.et: * Teab matemaatilistest meetoditest diferentsiaalvõrrandite lahendamiseks ning oskab neid rakendada.

independent_work.et:
* Density Functional Theory calculations of Cu crystal (bulk modulus and density of states).
* Monte Carlo simulation of phase transition of a simple 2D lattice.
* Molecular dynamics simulation of Cu crystal (thermal expansion)
* Finite element method simulation
* Mathematical method for analysing planetary movement

description.et:
Home assignments will be for all mayor topocs covered in course (DFT, MD, Monte Carlo, FEM) and will be graded from F-A (0-5) for each topic of the course based on the report. The basis of the grading is presentation and analysis of the results (conducted work, used methods, discovery of bugs, etc, ... ) in report. However, grading will not be conducted, until all the input files/source code needed for the assignment is presented. In order to pass the course it is absolutely necessary to receive at the least a grade E for each individual homework.

The time given for completing each homework is one week and it will be enforced by Moodle's homework submission system.

Homeworks contain two parts where the first part is small and is meant to see if everything is working correctly. Nevertheless, it must be submitted in order to receive the second part of the homework.

If the submission is late up to one week , then the highest obtainable score can be not higher than B (grade is reduced by 1). If the submission is late more than one week, the highest obtainable score is C (grade is reduced by 2). Penalties will not apply if a lecturer has sent back a homework for revision.

Final project of the course will be graded based on the report and following presentation of the report. Final grade is reached by combination of grades from lecturers, 2 referees and voting from the audience (40% + 20% + 20% + 20%).

grade_preconditions.et: All home exercises and the final project have to be passed with a positive grade.

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade is obtained by completing all the home exercises and the final project with a positive results. The final project will give 50% of the final grade and each individual home exercise 10%. 

The home exercises will be graded in the scale from 1 - 5 points, where 1 point will results in grade E and 5 points grade A. The final report of the homework has to be delivered on time and late admissions will be penalised by reducing the final grade by one point for the first week overdue and two points for longer. The technical difficulties have to be solved before the deadline and they have to reported at once. 

The project consists of a written part and an oral presentation in front of other students. The grading will be done in four parts. 40% of the grade will be given by the lecturer, 20% by the auditorium for the oral part and the final 20% + 20% by the two students who will be assigned to grade the work.

debt_elimination.et: It is possible to improve the grades received for home exercises and the project by attending an oral exam. If the grade received in the oral exam is worse than the initial grade then the one received in the oral exam will be used in final grade.
